name: yamtrack
description: Yamtrack is a self-hosted media and activity tracker that logs what you watch, read, or play. It aggregates entries into timelines and statistics, giving a personal overview of consumption habits.
features: Media logging: Track movies, TV shows, books, games, and other media you consume with manual or automated entries.
Timeline view: Visualize your consumption history on an interactive timeline showing what you watched or read when.
Statistics dashboard: View insights about your habits including total hours, favorite genres, and consumption patterns.
Rating system: Rate and review media items to remember your opinions and discover personal preferences over time.
Import functionality: Bulk import viewing history from streaming services and reading lists from other platforms.
Custom categories: Create personalized categories and tags to organize media beyond standard classifications.
Progress tracking: Monitor ongoing series, books, or games with completion percentages and episode counts.
Search and filter: Find past entries quickly with powerful search across titles, dates, and custom metadata.
Export data: Download your complete tracking history in JSON or CSV format for backup or analysis.
Privacy focused: Keep all consumption data on your own server without sharing with third-party services.
API integration: Connect with media databases like TMDB or IGDB to automatically fetch metadata and cover art.
Yearly summaries: Generate annual reports showing your most-watched genres, longest binges, and consumption trends.
